reviews.review: 명작

8000 dias depois de HL1, Gordo Frimão chega na Citadel 17 pra f'der com a vida dos Metrocop e dos Combine, o que causa uma guerra entre os cidadãos e o exército. É aí que começa a aventura:
  -História: Resumo dela aqui emcima, mas se quiser a completa, melhor comprar pq é baratin
  -Gráficos: Melhores do que os do HL1, pois aqueles eram dos anos 90.
  -Jogabilidade: Sabe Gmod? Pois bem, é tipo ele mas com história, e vc começa com uma crowbar e pistolinha.
                 
                     11/10 Acho que é melhor q HL3, pq eu vim do futuro :)
This game was wonderful with many complex levels and new enemies and made me realize why people want Half Life 3 so much. 9/10

Addressing Freeman
I'd like to take a moment to address you directly, Dr. Freeman.
Yes. I'm talking to you.
The so-called One Free Man. I have a question for you. How could you have thrown it all away? It staggers the mind.
A man of science, with the ability to sway reactionary and fearful minds toward the truth
choosing instead to embark on a path of ignorance and decay. Make no mistake, Dr. Freeman. This is not a scientific revolution you have sparked...this is death and finality.
You have plunged humanity into freefall.
Even if you offered your surrender now, I cannot guarantee that our benefactors would accept it.
At the moment, I fear they have begun to look upon even me with suspicion. So much for serving as humanity's representative.
Help me win back their trust, Dr. Freeman. Surrender while you still can.
Help ensure that humanity's trust in you is not misguided
Do what is right, Dr. Freeman.
Serve mankind.

Let's get this out of the way: the Source engine is showing its age – later Valve games have incorporated upgrades that are lacking in Half-Life 2. There isn’t much detail compared to more recent games, textures are blurry, and there are problems with lighting and shadows. All of that is true, but it really isn’t fair to criticize the game for that…it was made in 2004, and it looks like it was, but that doesn’t take away from how fun it is to play. And besides, if you’re really concerned about the graphics, you can always download one of the free community mods ([url=http://store.steampowered.com/app/290930/]Half-Life 2: Update[/url] for example) which make it look prettier.

On to my thoughts on the gameplay. I think the reason Half-Life 2 was (and still is) so successful is because the gameplay constantly evolves as you progress forward. As soon as you become comfortable, you’re presented with something which changes how you can approach each situation. After playing the beginning – which feels like a fairly standard shooter – you’re given the airboat and giant arenas to play around with. After a while of that, they give you a machine gun on the airboat, changing up how you use it. Then you’re given the gravity gun, and immediately thrust into Ravenholm, a haunting and creepy environment filled with saw blades, barrels, and other things you can throw at enemies. Then comes the dune buggy and ant-lions, and some of my favorite sections of the game. Traveling down Highway 17, dodging ant-lions as you ferret out combine strongholds on the coast, showcases some of the best that Half-Life 2 has to offer.

But the game isn’t done throwing new things at you. After fighting the ant-lions, you’re given a tool which makes them your allies, and you use them to assault Nova Prospekt, a claustrophobic prison where you’re given access to automated turrets and have to stand your ground against waves of Combine soldiers. Once you’ve escaped Nova Prospekt, you’re thrown into a full-blown rebellion and given command of a squad of resistance fighters. And then finally, at the end of the game, all of your weapons are taken away except for a super-powered gravity gun, and you get to experience what it’s like to throw men around like rag dolls as you rampage through the citadel.

Not all of these are executed perfectly – the squad command sections in particular hilariously showcase the shortcomings of the AI, with companions constantly getting in your way, running out to die from snipers or grenades, and generally acting like morons. Some of the pacing, particularly at the beginning of the game as you run through sewer after sewer and later as you crawl through Nova Prospekt, is tedious and repetitive. But it’s worth playing through those sections to see what comes next, because there’s always something new around the corner.

Half-Life 2 still does a far better job than most recent games in shifting the game’s paradigm constantly, and that evolving gameplay makes it successful – and fun to play over a decade later. If it’s been a while since you played it, it’s worth it to revisit it. If you’ve never played it before, it won’t wow you with its looks, but you’ll experience a classic with some of the best gameplay around – and widely considered one of the best games ever made.

Half-Life 2 is a game that, once you play, you will never forget.
i can say wholeheartedly that this game is one of the best, if not THE best, i have ever played in my entire life.
why?
lets take it from the top.
the game begins with a short cutscene, a monolouge by a man in the suit (dubbed, the Gman), which at the begining of the game doesn't make a whole lot of sense, but the farther you go into it, the more it will make sense to you. i should state here that knowledge of the previous game in the series (Half-life) is not required, but i will say that it is reccomended, as this games story will make more sense, as well as some of the throwbacks this game gives to its predecessor. as the Gman speaks, different locations flash on the screen, that add to the mysterious nature of this intro. Who is the Gman? Where are these places? What is he talking about? before you have time to ponder these questions, a loud horn interrupts you, as you are thrown straight into the game. you take a short monorail ride into City 17, and the game exhibits its art direction very well in this first section taking place in City 17. After events transpire, you are thrown into the action yet again, this time by yourself and only a crowbar to defend yourself. this is where the game introduces its combat system, and let me take this moment to say that this is one of the reasons i love this game. instead of showing you annoying tooltips that pop onto the screen, obscuring your vision, the game instead has you learn from experience how to use weapons. this game has a very old school feel to its combat system, and i really cant stress enough how good the combat feels and how precise it can be at times. over time, the story has you travelling to many different, beautiful looking locations (for a game from 2004, the graphical fidelity stands up surpisingly well, and at times looks better than many games being released nowadays) battling more intimidating foes as you go on. this can create some truly amazing moments in the story, such as when you battle a helicopter using an airboat with a machine gun mounted on the top of it. the sound design is good too, the music is never annoying, and the gun sounds never get on your nerves after hearing them thousands of times. in wanting to not spoil the game for those who have not played it, let me say that there are some truly emotional moments in the game, as well as some clever twists and turns placed here and there.

let me end this review off with saying that, if you have not played Half-Life 2 yet, please do yourself a huge favor and purchase this game. you will not regret your decision one bit. it has truly changed the way i view games.

Спасти мир
Покататься на багги и водном катамаране, побыть в роли муравьиной матки, поуправлять огромным подъемным краном, пострелять из разных стволов, побаловаться с грави-пушкой, поиграть в мяч с огромным металлическим псом, убить десяток страйдеров и... в итоге спасти мир...

Ностальгия
Вторая часть культовой серии Half-life, изменившая наше представление о том, какими прыжками может прогрессировать гейм-индустрия. В ней несомненно вы найдете атмосферу, угловатый юмор, затягивающий геймплей, достаточно неплохой, но все же предсказуемый сюжет, ПРАВИЛЬНУЮ физику, и много того, что навсегда отложится в вашей памяти. В серию можно играть бесконечно, но вернутся хочется только в самую первую игру. Без модов и сурсовского движка. В чистый и непорочный халф-лайф. 

Свобода выбора
На протяжении игры у нас не будет времени, чтобы остановится и осознать происходящее, попытаться как-то иначе повлиять на этот мир, изменить его согласно нашему желанию, а не желанию "нашего нанимателя с чемоданом". Поэтому будем довольствоваться тем, что есть. Идти по главам вперед, слушать подколы Илая в сторону Аликс и Фримена, хихикать от попыток безвкусно одетой "ассистентки" Илая подкатить к нашей персоне, просто идти вперед.

Une perle.
Peut-être un peu court (20h~ en difficulté max en prenant son temps), mais le digne successeur du 1.
Le pistolet anti-gravité est génial, et n'est pas trop puissant, on utilise tout autant les autres armes. Le scénar est génial, mais la fin semble un peu rapide, et laisse un gout d'inachevé.
Graphisme exceptionnel pour l'époque. La VF est impeccable, les musiques sont prenantes et beaucoup plus engagées que dans d'autres jeux (on a facilement du rock agressif ou de l'electro bien pulsée).
Peut-être un manque de variété dans les ennemis (surtout aliens, y en a 4-5 max différents, bon bon bon...)
Moteur physique plutôt très bien foutu, très bon ressenti dans les armes et les coups de feu. Toutes les armes (à part peut-être les pistolets) restent utiles jusqu'à la fin du jeu, une bonne surprise de ce côté-là.
A recommander sans aucune hésitation. Jouez au 1, régalez-vous, et enchaînez sur celui-ci, et régalez-vous à nouveau.

This game is a must have for any person who wants to call themselves a gamer. This game has puzzle elements, driving elements, stealth elements, and horror elements in addition to the great FPS theme and the great story. At one point, I had to go on catwalks under a bridge to get to the other side, only to have to fight to the end and disable the shield blocking my way across the top of the bridge with my car, but then to have to fight a gunship and go all the way back to my car and then drive over the bridge. In many games, that would have felt boring but in this game it felt fun and immersive, probably because of the weight on my character's shoulders to succeed. I didn't want to fail, because I knew the reward would be a new weapon or the satisfaction of saving the Resistance.

 The town of Ravenholm was genuinely freaky, and whenever I heard the gutter shake I shuddered. The airboat and buggy (car) levels are genuinely fun and bring an extra level of fun and immersiveness. By far my favorite part was commanding antlions in the prison of Nova Prospekt. I got so much satisfaction out of leading my antlions to victory against the detachments of Combine soldiers. The turret battles in Entanglement add to the feeling of being a commander, and the squad mechanics in Anticitizen One only reinforce that feeling.

 I have played through only 10 of the levels (Anticitizen One) and played 25 hours as of the posting of this review, but it feels like me and Gordon have been comrades for a lot longer than that. This game is hard, but doesn't make you retry something 20 times, because you get it right the 4th or 5th time. Each level takes about 1 hr with a walkthrough (http://www.visualwalkthroughs.com/halflife2/halflife2walkthrough.htm) and 1.5 to 2 hrs without one, but Route Kanal, Water Hazard, We Don't Go To Ravenholm, Anticitizen One, and Follow Freeman may take longer (2.5 to 3 hrs at the longest), making Half-Life 2 a medium length game.

 The graphics are good (not that amazing in comparison to games like Shadow of Mordor) but hold up ok today, and they are pretty realistic (if you aren't that picky about HD graphics or extremely detailed sprites). The gameplay is pretty immersive, and the controls and handling are pretty good. The story and character development are extremely good, especially for a FPS, which are usually about gameplay, and usually don't focus on story or graphics. The world in Half-Life 2 felt alive, and I felt the character's emotions and understood their feelings. The world felt like it was real, and Anticitizen One made me sad inside, how City 17 was plunged into a conflict with zombies, fire, and destroyed property everywhere, and the Resistance had to fight to be free and live in peace.

 This game will make you feel emotional. The OK graphics, great gameplay, amazing story, immersive world, and the diversity of themes that allow anyone to enjoy multiple game types (driving, FPS, parkour, puzzle) and can introduce anyone to new game types brought me to a final rating of 9.5/10. The game is dated a little, but it still holds up well (The Xbox 360 and PS3 versions in The Orange Box were also amazing). Anyone who wants to call themselves a gamer should play Half-Life 2.

군더더기를 빼버리고 스토리와 진행에만 몰입하도록 잘 짜여진 일자진행 게임 구조, 논리적이고 직관적인 퍼즐로 FPS 일방통행 싱글플레이의 정수를 보여주는 하프라이프 2입니다.


 게임 내적으로는 클리어 후에도 또 하고 싶을 재미를 선사하였지만 스트라이더 파괴 챕터의 진행방식이 상당히 어거지인 점 (스트라이더 발견 -> 로켓 탄이 없어서 도망(최대 보유 로켓탄 보다 스트라이더맷집이 더 높음) -> 로켓탄약상자 찾을때까지 뺑이 -> 찾으면 스트라이더 삭제 -> 처음부터 반복)과 
챕터당 하나의 로딩이 아니라 한 챕터를 잘게 나눠서 자주 로딩하는 방식은 당시에는 성능을 극복한 좋은 꼼수였겠지만 10년이 지난 지금은 최신 사양에도 엔딩까지 수백번씩 흐름을 끊어버리고 버벅이면서 맵을 로딩하는 바람에 한창 진행중 게임의 흥미가 식어버립니다. 덕분에 엔딩 본 이후에는 도전과제고 뭐고 더 이상은 하고싶지 않아졌습니다.


 부정적인 코멘트를 길게달긴 했지만, 10년이 지난 시대에도 재미 하나만큼은 보장한 게임입니다. 아직 해보시지 않았다면 스팀세일 때 구입을 추천합니다.

This game, it is one of my favorites, and i wish i could play it again without knowing what will happen, but sadly i can't, and this hurts the replay value. Altogether the first few hours are pretty boring, but once you get about halfway through, it gets really interesting. I bought it on sale (the half life complete pack) for $10, but i dont play the others, and would pay for this game by itself for that $10. It is a great time waster for the time it takes to beat it, but after that you dont feel the urge to play it again, as you already know whats going to happen. But you should still buy it just for the experience, because it is a great game.

第一次发现hl2是在当年卫星电视的一个外国频道，播放的是17号城市的场景，第一次看见三足机甲，心生崇拜。往后一直关注这款游戏，即便一直没有条件和机会游玩，还是在常买的杂志里看到了不少报道，当然后来基本是普遍赞誉。

但hl2的出现貌似很“坎坷”，最著名的是黑客在发售前破解valve邮箱泄露源代码---杂志是这么说的！泄露版本很不堪完全诋毁了这款游戏，我觉得拜黑客技术不够，或者非本公司不了解代码所赐，hl2及其续篇的光辉遮蔽了这段历史，因为当时局限于国内杂志的主观观点（黑客事件时基本都在黑valve）和信息渠道的局限，无法判断这事情对valve影响到底大不大，所以就不再说了。

真正玩到这款游戏是令我最最最难忘的体验，被它的技术震撼，为它的物理引擎而折服，有史以来最逼真的水面效果（即便现在也是），引人入胜的故事剧情，超乎其凡的想象力，最酷的外星科技，恐怖的莱温霍姆，最爽快的打僵尸（爱死那把散弹枪了！）。

我依然记得在商店里发现正版hl2时的激动，想尽办法买下来以后发现是7cd版（6？5？忘了），第一次认识steam，印象最深的是steam提醒要好好保管账号，不然取回的过程将极其之复杂，现在steam也依然重视账号安全啊哈哈。

hl2重玩次数之多想必喜欢它的都懂，它的魅力在每一处、每一个关卡，如同valve做的每一款游戏。hl2的关卡设计即便如今重玩也充满新鲜感和活力，比如今生产线游戏好太多了，一个FPS爱好者假如没能体验过hl2那真是莫大遗憾！

You will be unable to work out where you're supposed to go at least once. You will be surprised that such a polished game can expect you to jump and walk on some very narrow, hard-to-notice things. You will have to take several breaks during Ravenholm to calm your nerves.

But you'll still see why this game is as highly viewed as it is.

I know this game is old but I still love it. It's engaging has decent graphics and continues the Gordan Freeman story in a great way. However it's buggy as hell. I've gotten to a point where it crashes every time and I cannot continue the game. It means starting over and loosing all my progress and even possibly running into the same issue. Running Windows 10 64 bit is just too much for this game.

Poi, tutto a un tratto, senti una tromba di treno e vedi luce tutt'intorno. 
Sei su un treno sconosciuto, diretto verso una città sconosciuta. Cosa è successo mentre non c'eri?

Half life 2 è una gemma di videogioco: 
[list]
    [*] Sparatutto frenetico con giocattoli tecnologici davvero interessanti
    [*] Interazioni fisiche simulate con molta precisione: collisioni, attrito, fluidi
    [*] Un capolavoro di storia: scoprirai cosa è successo dopo Black Mesa
    [*] Scenari unici
    [*] Nemici ben armati e vari
    [*] Requisiti di sistema bassi
    [*] Prezzo basso e ben oltre che abbordabile (soprattutto dopo i saldi)
[/list]

Ho preferito molto di più il doppiaggio inglese a quello italiano, consiglio di provare (magari con i sottotitoli).

Consiglio caldamente di giocarlo, merita ogni centesimo che costa.
Ovviamente però giocate prima il primo [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/70/HalfLife]Half-Life[/url] (o, se proprio non digerite la grafica 'vintage' c'è sempre il suo degno remake: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/362890/Black_Mesa/]Black Mesa[/url])

10/10 è sicuramente uno dei miei preferiti.

[b]This review does not contain any spoilers - as far as I'm aware...[/b]

I've just completed Half-Life 2 and find there is so much to say about this, it would be impossible to do it within the amount of time I'm wanting to spend writing this review, and so I'll make a short..ish review - or I'll try to anyway. 

This game is very interesting, for it was made years ago and contains so much... thought and creativity. I must admit, through the first half of the game, I was becoming bored. It just seemed as though I was doing the same thing all the time. However, one thing I did pick up was the puzzles. There were some puzzles that got me confused during the first half of the game, and I find that to be a very creative thing to add in to this kind of game. It has a sci-fi element, and when puzzles and sci-fi are put together, it really does create an amazing experience. 

During the second half of the game, I found I was starting to enjoy the game more. I'd began to rush through the game due to it's massive story line. By rushing, I mean I sprinted and jumped and just full-out went in shooting enemies and picking up those health kits ASAP. It really was a big help and I died a lot less - believe it or not. 

New enemies were introduced in the second half and I found it really cool about 3/4 into the game where something special about one of the enemies had came up. I won't say any more due to the fact that I don't want to give spoilers. 

At the end of the game, I felt amazed. The last level really was something, and it was totally worth the wait, as I had been told by a couple of people that have played the game before me. Everything they said was true. The last level really is worth the countless hours of gameplay to get there, and the main enemy behind all of the... chaos... was amazing.

The ending made me a little bit confused - but I think that was supposed to happen. You can find out for yourself when you play the game. ;)

During the game, there are a lot of conversations that you have to stand and listen to (or ignore) before you can continue the level. This was very fraustrating for me, and you may fidn it fraustrating as well. A couple of friends have told me that it was also very fraustrating for them, too.

Overall, I'd say this game really was a big step towards the new games that are produced now. All of it's creativity seems to have been expanded into lots of AAA games out there right now and improved. I'd rate this game 7/10 due to it being a little bit long-winded - but trust me, it's totally worth it. Also I deducted another point due to the un-skippable conversations that you have to go through.

Also, there is a free update for the graphics. I have not used it for my gameplay experience, but you, personally, might like some better graphics. So go on the Steam Store and get "Half-Life 2: Update" for free once you have bought the main game. :)
